skill.英释: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it

table.英释: a piece of furniture with a flat top supported by legs

south.英释: in or to the southern part of England

local.英释: someone who lives in the place where you are or the place that you are talking about

cover.英释: the outer front or back part of a magazine, book etc

reach.英释: the limit of someone’s power or ability to do something

allow.英释: to accept that something is correct or true, or that something is acceptable according to the rules or law

house.英释: to provide someone with a place to live

today.英释: the day that is happening now

clear.英释: if a liquid clears, it becomes more transparent and you can see through it

glass.英释: a transparent solid substance used for making windows, bottles etc

range.英释: to put things in a particular order or position

green.英释: to fill an area with growing plants in order to make it more attractive

right.英释: exactly in a particular position or place

lower.英释: to reduce something in amount, degree, strength etc, or to become less

upper.英释: in a higher position than something else

learn.英释: to gain knowledge of a subject or skill, by experience, by studying it, or by being taught

value.英释: to think that someone or something is important

raise.英释: to move or lift something to a higher position, place, or level

short.英释: happening or continuing for only a little time or for less time than usual

style.英释: a particular way of doing, designing, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular place, period of time, or group of people

break.英释: to end a period of silence by talking or making a noise

steam.英释: the hot mist that water produces when it is boiled

field.英释: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

print.英释: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc

goods.英释: things that are produced in order to be sold

store.英释: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.

story.英释: a description of how something happened, that is intended to entertain people, and may be true or imaginary

train.英释: to teach someone the skills of a particular job or activity, or to be taught these skills

canal.英释: a long passage dug into the ground and filled with water, either for boats to travel along, or to take water to a place

craft.英释: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do

argue.英释: to disagree with someone in words, often in an angry way

above.英释: in a higher position than something else

apply.英释: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something

sense.英释: if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

teach.英释: to give lessons in a school, college, or university, or to help someone learn about something by giving them information

rural.英释: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

worth.英释: an amount of something worth ten pounds, $500 etc

imply.英释: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

basic.英释: forming the most important or most necessary part of something

start.英释: to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it

rapid.英释: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

coast.英释: the area where the land meets the sea

claim.英释: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

plate.英释: used in the names of sports competitions or races in which the winner gets a silver plate …

plain.英释: very clear, and easy to understand or recognize

adult.英释: a fully-grown person, or one who is considered to be legally responsible for their actions

brain.英释: the organ inside your head that controls how you think, feel, and move

grass.英释: an area of grass, especially an area where the grass is kept cut short

minor.英释: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

third.英释: one of three equal parts of something

route.英释: a way from one place to another

stage.英释: a particular time or state that something reaches as it grows or develops

thing.英释: an idea, action, feeling, or fact that someone thinks, does, says, or talks about, or that happens

never.英释: not at any time, or not once

party.英释: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc

quite.英释: You use quite to indicate that something is the case to a fairly great extent

drill.英释: to teach students, sports players etc by making them repeat the same lesson, exercise etc many times

serve.英释: to help the customers in a shop, especially by bringing them the things that they want

cause.英释: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

solid.英释: a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

stand.英释: to support yourself on your feet or be in an upright position

clock.英释: an instrument that shows what time it is, in a room or outside on a building

adapt.英释: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

Dutch.英释: relating to the Netherlands, its people, or its language

focus.英释: the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

drift.英释: to move slowly on water or in the air

price.英释: to decide the price of something that is for sale

Greek.英释: relating to Greece, its people, or its language

equal.英释: to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

total.英释: the final number or amount of things, people etc when everything has been counted

speak.英释: to talk to someone about something

shift.英释: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one

again.英释: one more time – used when something has happened or been done before

prove.英释: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc

paper.英释: material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc

issue.英释: a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

month.英释: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

depth.英释: how strong an emotion is or how serious a situation is

basin.英释: a round container attached to the wall in a bathroom, where you wash your hands and face

money.英释: what you earn by working and can use to buy things. Money can be in the form of notes and coins or cheques, and can be kept in a bank

flood.英释: a very large amount of water that covers an area that is usually dry

black.英释: having the darkest colour, like coal or night

shell.英释: to fire shells from large guns at something

birth.英释: if a woman gives birth, she produces a baby from her body

agree.英释: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

offer.英释: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it

share.英释: to let someone have or use something that belongs to you

topic.英释: a subject that people talk or write about

block.英释: to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

avoid.英释: to prevent something bad from happening

carve.英释: to make an object or pattern by cutting a piece of wood or stone

death.英释: a creature that looks like a human  skeleton  , used in paintings, stories etc to represent the fact that people die

class.英释: a period of time during which someone teaches a group of people, especially in a school

crust.英释: the hard brown outer surface of bread

trace.英释: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed

floor.英释: the flat surface that you stand on inside a building

dense.英释: made of or containing a lot of things or people that are very close together

steel.英释: strong metal that can be shaped easily, consisting of iron and  carbon

thick.英释: if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides

fruit.英释: something that grows on a plant, tree, or bush, can be eaten as a food, contains seeds or a stone, and is usually sweet

shelf.英释: a long flat narrow board attached to a wall or in a frame or cupboard, used for putting things on

model.英释: to wear clothes at a fashion show or in magazine photographs in order to show them to people

habit.英释: something that you do regularly or usually, often without thinking about it because you have done it so many times before

moral.英释: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

sleep.英释: to rest your mind and body, usually at night when you are lying in bed with your eyes closed

white.英释: the colour of milk, salt, and snow

trail.英释: to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

tribe.英释: a social group consisting of people of the same  race  who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader

inner.英释: on the inside or close to the centre of something

scale.英释: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening

mouth.英释: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

spend.英释: to use your money to pay for goods or services

yield.英释: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

adopt.英释: to take someone else’s child into your home and legally become its parent

crack.英释: to break or to make something break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces

comet.英释: an object in space like a bright ball with a long tail, that moves around the sun

prior.英释: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

acorn.英释: the nut of the  oak  tree

fresh.英释: good or interesting because it has not been done, seen etc before

civil.英释: relating to the people who live in a country

final.英释: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc

alder.英释: An alder is a species of tree or shrub that grows especially in cool, damp places and loses its leaves in winter

title.英释: When a writer, composer, or artist titles a work, they give it a name

waste.英释: when something such as money or skills are not used in a way that is effective, useful, or sensible

horse.英释: a large strong animal that people ride and use for pulling heavy things

rocky.英释: covered with rocks or made of rock

night.英释: the dark part of each 24-hour period when the sun cannot be seen and when most people sleep

front.英释: if a building or area of land is fronted by something, or fronts onto it, it faces that thing

surge.英释: if a feeling surges or surges up, you begin to feel it very strongly

tooth.英释: one of the hard white objects in your mouth that you use to bite and eat food

radio.英释: a piece of electronic equipment which you use to listen to programmes that are broadcast, such as music and news

enter.英释: to start working in a particular profession or organization, or to start studying at a school or university

press.英释: to be criticized in the newspapers or on radio or television

frame.英释: to organize and develop a plan, system etc

ideal.英释: the best or most suitable that something could possibly be

beach.英释: an area of sand or small stones at the edge of the sea or a lake

drive.英释: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along

guild.英释: an organization of people who do the same job or have the same interests

decay.英释: if traditional beliefs, standards etc decay, people do not believe in them or support them any more

flash.英释: to shine suddenly and brightly for a short time, or to make something shine in this way

movie.英释: a film made to be shown at the cinema or on television

float.英释: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

storm.英释: a period of very bad weather when there is a lot of rain or snow, strong winds, and often  lightning

polar.英释: close to or relating to the North Pole or the South Pole

elite.英释: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

ridge.英释: a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain

bound.英释: the limits of what is possible or acceptable

China.英释: China is a hard white substance made from clay. It is used to make things such as cups, bowls, plates, and ornaments.

broad.英释: a road, river, or part of someone’s body etc that is broad is wide

virus.英释: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

alter.英释: to change, or to make someone or something change

erode.英释: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

arise.英释: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

stick.英释: if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

toxic.英释: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

visit.英释: to go and spend time in a place or with someone, especially for pleasure or interest

apart.英释: If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

cross.英释: if two or more roads, lines, etc cross, or if one crosses another, they go across each other

drain.英释: a pipe that carries water or waste liquids away

novel.英释: a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary

wheat.英释: the grain that bread is made from, or the plant that it grows on

catch.英释: to see someone doing something that they did not want you to know they were doing

match.英释: if one thing matches another, or if two things match, they look attractive together because they are a similar colour, pattern etc

motif.英释: an idea, subject, or image that is regularly repeated and developed in a book, film, work of art etc

wheel.英释: to push something that has wheels somewhere

tulip.英释: a brightly coloured flower that is shaped like a cup and grows from a  bulb  in spring

pound.英释: to hit something very hard several times and make a lot of noise, damage it, break it into smaller pieces etc

brown.英释: the colour of earth, wood, or coffee

alone.英释: if you are alone in a place, there is no one with you

trend.英释: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

modem.英释: a piece of electronic equipment that allows information from one computer to be sent along telephone wires to another computer

shrub.英释: a small bush with several woody stems

clean.英释: to remove dirt from something by rubbing or washing

drama.英释: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

extra.英释: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number

algae.英释: a very simple plant without stems or leaves that grows in or near water

tower.英释: a tall narrow building either built on its own or forming part of a castle, church etc

union.英释: used in the names of some clubs or organizations

fluid.英释: fluid movements are smooth, relaxed, and graceful

track.英释: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc

forth.英释: going out from a place or point, and moving forwards or outwards

giant.英释: an extremely tall strong man, who is often bad and cruel, in children’s stories

sheet.英释: a piece of paper for writing on, or containing information

rigid.英释: rigid methods, systems etc are very strict and difficult to change

zebra.英释: an animal that looks like a horse but has black and white lines all over its body

heart.英释: the organ in your chest which pumps blood through your body

skull.英释: the bones of a person’s or animal’s head

breed.英释: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm

solve.英释: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

shale.英释: a smooth soft rock which breaks easily into thin flat pieces

maker.英释: a person or company that makes a particular type of goods

count.英释: to calculate the total number of things or people in a group

hyper.英释: extremely excited or nervous about something

graze.英释: to touch something lightly while passing it, sometimes damaging it

organ.英释: an organization that is part of, or works for, a larger organization or group

wagon.英释: a strong vehicle with four wheels, used for carrying heavy loads and usually pulled by horses

brick.英释: a hard block of baked clay used for building walls, houses etc

vital.英释: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

agent.英释: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business

weave.英释: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom

empty.英释: to remove everything that is inside something

piano.英释: a large musical instrument that has a long row of black and white  key s  . You play the piano by sitting in front of it and pressing the keys.

proxy.英释: if you do something by proxy, you arrange for someone else to do it for you

spore.英释: a cell like a seed that is produced by some plants such as  mushrooms  and can develop into a new plant

drink.英释: to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it

cheap.英释: not at all expensive, or lower in price than you expected

theme.英释: the main subject or idea in a piece of writing, speech, film etc

fight.英释: to take part in a war or battle

twist.英释: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape

doubt.英释: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right

treat.英释: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way

plane.英释: a vehicle that flies in the air and has wings and at least one engine

gland.英释: an organ of the body which produces a substance that the body needs, such as hormones, sweat, or saliva

glaze.英释: a liquid that is used to cover plates, cups etc made of clay to give them a shiny surface

chain.英释: a connected series of events or actions, especially which lead to a final result

score.英释: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

orbit.英释: to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

grind.英释: to make something smooth or sharp by rubbing it on a hard surface or by using a machine

cease.英释: to stop doing something or stop happening

crude.中释: 天然的,未加工的,粗鲁的
crude.英释: not exact or without any detail, but generally correct and useful

nerve.英释: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

flake.英释: to break off in small thin pieces

sheep.英释: a farm animal that is kept for its wool and its meat

mercy.英释: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

lewis.英释: a lifting device for heavy stone or concrete blocks consisting of a number of curved pieces of metal or wedges fitting into a dovetailed recess cut into the block

award.英释: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done

usual.英释: happening, done, or existing most of the time or in most situations

touch.英释: if two things touch, or one thing touches another thing, they reach each other so that there is no space between them

guide.中释: 领路人,指南 vt指导, 支配
guide.英释: a book or piece of writing that provides information on a particular subject or explains how to do something

taste.英释: to eat or drink a small amount of something to see what it is like

panel.英释: a board in a car, plane, boat etc that has the controls on it

react.英释: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

hotel.英释: A hotel is a building where people stay, for example on holiday, paying for their rooms and meals

found.英释: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

motor.英释: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

marsh.英释: an area of low flat ground that is always wet and soft

trust.英释: to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

hatch.中释: 孵化 vt孵出, 策划
hatch.英释: the act or process of hatching

shore.英释: the land along the edge of a large area of water such as an ocean or lake

burst.英释: if something bursts, or if you burst it, it breaks open or apart suddenly and violently so that its contents come out

spray.英释: liquid which is forced out of a special container in a stream of very small drops

larva.英释: a young insect with a soft tube-shaped body, which will later become an insect with wings

sharp.英释: having a very thin edge or point that can cut things easily

brush.中释: 刷子, 毛刷, 画笔 vt刷, 掸, 拂
brush.英释: an object that you use for cleaning, painting, making your hair tidy etc, made with a lot of hairs,  bristle s  , or thin pieces of plastic, fastened to a handle

watch.英释: to look at someone or something for a period of time, paying attention to what is happening

marry.英释: if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife

frost.英释: to cover a cake with a mixture of powdery sugar and liquid

judge.中释: 法官,裁判员 v断定,裁决
judge.英释: the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

media.英释: all the organizations, such as television, radio, and newspapers, that provide news and information for the public, or the people who do this work

throw.英释: to make an object such as a ball move quickly through the air by pushing your hand forward quickly and letting the object go

fauna.英释: all the animals living in a particular area or period in history

pearl.英释: a small round white object that forms inside an  oyster  , and is a valuable jewel

slope.英释: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes

sloth.英释: an animal in Central and South America that moves very slowly, has grey fur, and lives in trees

shade.英释: slight darkness or shelter from the direct light of the sun made by something blocking it

click.英释: to make a short hard sound, or make something produce this sound

board.英释: a flat piece of wood, plastic, card etc that you use for a particular purpose such as cutting things on, or for playing indoor games

strip.英释: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else

stock.英释: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell

camel.英释: a large desert animal with a long neck and either one or two  hump s (= large raised parts )  on its back

elect.英释: to choose someone for an official position by voting

aware.英释: if you are aware that a situation exists, you realize or know that it exists

dairy.英释: a place on a farm where milk is kept and butter and cheese are made

phase.英释: one of the stages of a process of development or change

realm.英释: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

niche.中释: 壁龛,合适的职务(环境、位置等)
niche.英释: a hollow place in a wall, often made to hold a statue

tract.中释: 传单,小册子,大片(土地或森林)

spear.英释: a pole with a sharp pointed blade at one end, used as a weapon in the past

equip.英释: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

aside.英释: moved to one side or away from you

cliff.英释: a large area of rock or a mountain with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or a river

stiff.英释: firm, hard, or difficult to bend

roost.英释: a place where birds rest and sleep

alarm.中释: 警报 vt恐吓, 警告
alarm.英释: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger

angle.英释: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

shoot.英释: to make a bullet or  arrow  come from a weapon

eagle.英释: a very large strong bird with a beak like a hook that eats small animals, birds etc

chart.英释: information that is clearly arranged in the form of a simple picture, set of figures,  graph  etc, or a piece of paper with this information on it

enemy.英释: someone who hates you and wants to harm you

relic.英释: an old object or custom that reminds people of the past or that has lived on from a past time

smell.英释: the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

biome.英释: a type of environment that is described according to the typical weather conditions and plants that exist there

mount.英释: If you mount the stairs or a platform, you go up the stairs or go up onto the platform

ready.英释: if you are ready, you are prepared for what you are going to do

magma.英释: hot melted rock below the surface of the Earth

fault.英释: to criticize someone or something for a mistake

swamp.英释: land that is always very wet or covered with a layer of water

ratio.英释: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

noise.英释: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or frightening

crowd.英释: a large group of people who have gathered together to do something, for example to watch something or protest about something

pride.英释: a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved

court.英释: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the  jury  who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

linen.英释: cloth made from the flax plant, used to make high quality clothes, home decorations etc

dream.英释: to think about something that you would like to happen or have

truly.英释: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true

smile.英释: to make your mouth curve upwards, in order to be friendly or because you are happy or amused

Latin.英释: the language used in ancient Rome

split.英释: if a group of people splits, or if it is split, people in the group disagree strongly with each other and the group sometimes divides into separate smaller groups

lomas.中释: 洛马斯(阿根廷东部的一城镇)

spite.英释: without being affected or prevented by something

truth.英释: the true facts about something, rather than what is untrue, imagined, or guessed

sieve.英释: to put flour or other food through a sieve

delay.英释: to wait until a later time to do something

delta.英释: an area of low land where a river spreads into many smaller rivers near the sea

thank.英释: to tell someone that you are pleased and grateful for something they have done, or to be polite about it

slide.英释: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way

argon.英释: a colourless gas that is found in very small quantities in the air and is sometimes used in electric light  bulb s  . It is a chemical  element  : symbol Ar

robin.英释: a small European bird with a red breast and brown back

diver.英释: someone who swims or works under water using special equipment to help them breathe

flock.英释: if people flock to a place, they go there in large numbers because something interesting or exciting is happening there

harsh.英释: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

finch.英释: a small bird with a short beak

patch.英释: a small piece of material that is sewn on something to cover a hole in it

lunar.英释: relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon

stamp.英释: to walk somewhere in a noisy way by putting your feet down hard onto the ground because you are angry

quilt.英释: If you quilt, or if you quilt a piece of fabric, you make a quilt

dwell.英释: to live in a particular place

oxide.英释: a substance which is produced when a substance is combined with oxygen

slush.英释: Slush is snow that has begun to melt and is therefore very wet and dirty

fluke.英释: something good that happens because of luck

probe.英释: to ask questions in order to find things out, especially things that other people do not want you to know

smoke.英释: to suck or breathe in smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc or to do this regularly as a habit

climb.英释: to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do

grant.英释: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

noisy.英释: someone or something that is noisy makes a lot of noise

cheep.中释: 吱吱的叫声 v吱吱地叫
cheep.英释: the short weak high-pitched cry of a young bird; chirp

humid.中释: 充满潮湿的, 湿润的
humid.英释: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

sandy.英释: covered with sand or containing a lot of sand

dwarf.英释: a person who is a dwarf has not continued to grow to the normal height because of a medical condition. Many people think that this use is offensive.

adept.中释: 熟练的, 老练的 n老手, 擅长者
adept.英释: good at something that needs care and skill

prose.英释: language in its usual form, as opposed to poetry

karst.中释: 石灰岩地区常见的地形
karst.英释: denoting the characteristic scenery of a limestone region, including underground streams, gorges, etc

queen.英释: a playing card with a picture of a queen on it

mound.英释: a pile of earth or stones that looks like a small hill

scent.英释: a pleasant smell that something has

unity.英释: when a group of people or countries agree or are joined together

sport.英释: an activity that people do in the countryside, especially hunting or fishing

voter.英释: someone who has the right to vote in a political election, or who votes in a particular election

April.英释: the fourth month of the year, between March and May

cargo.英释: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

rainy.英释: a rainy period of time is one when it rains a lot

trial.英释: a process of testing to find out whether something works effectively and is safe

wound.英释: an injury to your body that is made by a weapon such as a knife or a bullet

moist.英释: slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable

coral.英释: a hard red, white, or pink substance formed from the bones of very small sea creatures, which is often used to make jewellery

adobe.英释: earth and  straw  that are made into bricks for building houses

swing.英释: to make regular movements forwards and backwards or from one side to another while hanging from a particular point, or to make something do this

hardy.英释: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions

stunt.中释: 特技；噱头 v阻碍正常成长
stunt.英释: a dangerous action that is done to entertain people, especially in a film

relax.英释: to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

scrub.英释: low bushes and trees that grow in very dry soil

stalk.中释: 茎，梗 v跟踪,高视阔步地走
stalk.英释: a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers

coach.中释: 教练；长途公共汽车 vt训练，指导
coach.英释: someone who trains a person or team in a sport

quiet.英释: not making much noise, or making no noise at all

pilot.英释: someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft

flour.英释: a powder that is made by crushing wheat or other grain and is used for making bread, cakes etc

otter.英释: an animal with smooth brown fur that swims in rivers and eats fish

valid.中释: 有效的,有根据的,合法的
valid.英释: a valid ticket, document, or agreement is legally or officially acceptable

scene.英释: what is happening in a place, or what can be seen happening

fifth.英释: coming after four other things in a series

fence.英释: a structure made of wood, metal etc that surrounds a piece of land

swarm.英释: a large group of insects, especially  bee s  ,moving together

alloy.英释: a metal that consists of two or more metals mixed together

tidal.中释: 潮汐的, 定时涨落的
tidal.英释: relating to the regular rising and falling of the sea

flask.英释: a glass bottle with a narrow top, used in a  laboratory

slice.英释: a thin flat piece of food cut from a larger piece

blast.中释: 爆炸；一阵(疾风等) vt炸，炸掉
blast.英释: an explosion, or the very strong movement of air that it causes

sweep.英释: to clean the dust, dirt etc from the floor or ground, using a brush with a long handle

renew.英释: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place

flame.英释: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire

cloth.英释: material used for making things such as clothes

entry.英释: the act of going into something

stave.英释: one of the thin curved pieces of wood fitted close together to form the sides of a  barrel

curve.英释: a line that gradually bends like part of a circle

joint.英释: a part of your body that can bend because two bones meet there

woody.英释: a woody plant has a stem like wood

stony.英释: covered by stones or containing stones

steep.英释: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

cajun.中释: 移居美国路易斯安纳州的法人后裔
cajun.英释: A Cajun is a person of Cajun origin

bread.英释: a type of food made from flour and water that is mixed together and then baked

flush.英释: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed

crane.英释: a large tall machine used by builders for lifting heavy things

ledge.英释: a narrow flat piece of rock that sticks out on the side of a mountain or cliff

knife.英释: a metal blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon

erect.英释: to build something such as a building or wall

crown.英释: a mark, sign,  badge  etc in the shape of a crown, used especially to show rank or quality

audio.英释: relating to sound that is recorded or broadcast

radar.英释: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

chill.英释: if you chill something such as food or drink, or if it chills, it becomes very cold but does not freeze

swift.英释: happening or done quickly and immediately

prowl.英释: if someone prowls, they move around an area slowly and quietly, especially because they are involved in a criminal activity or because they are looking for something

sugar.英释: a sweet white or brown substance that is obtained from plants and used to make food and drinks sweet

ethic.英释: a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes

cabin.英释: a small house, especially one built of wood in an area of forest or mountains

slate.英释: a dark grey rock that can easily be split into flat thin pieces

fetus.英释: A fetus is an animal or human being in its later stages of development before it is born

cedar.英释: a large  evergreen  tree with leaves shaped like needles

moose.英释: a large brown animal like a  deer  that has very large flat  antler s (= horns that grow like branches )  and lives in North America, northern Europe, and parts of Asia

scout.英释: a soldier, plane etc that is sent to search the area in front of an army and get information about the enemy

xenon.中释: 氙(惰性气体的一种,元素符号Xe)
xenon.英释: a colourless gas that is found in very small quantities in the air. It is a chemical element: symbol Xe

alert.英释: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc

Asian.英释: someone from Asia, or whose family originally came from Asia, especially India or Pakistan

proof.英释: facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

kneel.英释: to be in or move into a position where your body is resting on your knees

elder.英释: to be older than someone else

stove.英释: a piece of kitchen equipment on which you cook food in pots and pans, and that contains an  oven

false.英释: a statement, story etc that is false is completely untrue

slick.英释: if someone is slick, they are good at persuading people, often in a way that does not seem honest

lease.英释: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

recur.英释: if something, especially something bad or unpleasant, recurs, it happens again

reset.英释: to restart a computer without switching the power off

shock.英释: if something that happens is a shock, you did not expect it, and it makes you feel very surprised, and usually upset

shaft.英释: a long handle on a tool,  spear  etc

magic.中释: 魔术；魔力 a有魔力的
magic.英释: a special, attractive, or exciting quality

alien.英释: someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

taxes.英释: Tax is an amount of money that you have to pay to the government so that it can pay for public services such as road and schools

spoil.英释: to give a child everything they want, or let them do whatever they want, often with the result that they behave badly

width.英释: the distance from one side of something to the other

upset.英释: to make someone feel unhappy or worried

blend.英释: to thoroughly mix together soft or liquid substances to form a single smooth substance

brass.英释: a very hard bright yellow metal that is a mixture of  copper  and  zinc

igloo.英释: Igloos are dome-shaped houses built from blocks of snow by the Inuit people

laser.英释: a piece of equipment that produces a powerful narrow beam of light that can be used in medical operations, to cut metals, or to make patterns of light for entertainment

prone.英释: likely to do something or suffer from something, especially something bad or harmful

peach.英释: a round juicy fruit that has a soft yellow or red skin and a large, hard seed in the centre, or the tree that this fruit grows on

trout.英释: a common river-fish, often used for food, or the flesh of this fish

peace.英释: a situation in which there is no war or fighting

farce.英释: an event or a situation that is very badly organized or does not happen properly, in a way that is silly and unreasonable

vague.英释: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

ounce.英释: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 28.35 grams. There are 16 ounces in a pound.

dress.英释: a piece of clothing worn by a woman or girl that covers the top of her body and part or all of her legs

Anglo.中释: 盎格鲁, 英裔美国人
Anglo.英释: a White inhabitant of the United States who is not of Latin extraction

timer.英释: an instrument that you use to measure time, when you are doing something such as cooking

reign.英释: if a feeling or quality reigns, it exists strongly for a period of time

tempt.英释: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

boast.英释: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

wedge.英释: a piece of food shaped like a wedge

embed.英释: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

sweet.英释: containing or having a taste like sugar

maser.英释: a piece of equipment that produces a very powerful electric force

resin.英释: a thick sticky liquid that comes out of some trees

frown.英释: to make an angry, unhappy, or confused expression, moving your  eyebrows  together

stain.英释: a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

medal.英释: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

spout.英释: if a  whale  spouts, it sends out a stream of water from a hole in its head

cramp.英释: to prevent the development of someone or something

snake.英释: an animal with a long thin body and no legs, that often has a poisonous bite

perry.英释: an alcoholic drink made from  pear s

spark.英释: to be the cause of something, especially trouble or violence

spine.英释: the row of bones down the centre of your back that supports your body and protects your  spinal cord

widen.英释: to become wider, or to make something wider

steer.英释: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel

acute.英释: an acute illness or disease quickly becomes very serious

admit.英释: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

mouse.英释: a small furry animal with a pointed nose and a long tail that lives in people’s houses or in fields

beast.英释: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one

shirt.英释: a piece of clothing that covers the upper part of your body and your arms, usually has a collar, and is fastened at the front by buttons

eager.英释: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

trick.英释: to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something

array.英释: a set of numbers or signs, or of computer memory units, arranged in lines across or down

globe.英释: a round object with a map of the Earth drawn on it

merge.英释: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

input.英释: information that is put into a computer

maple.英释: a tree which grows mainly in northern countries such as Canada. Its leaves have five points and turn red or gold in autumn.

hinge.英释: a piece of metal fastened to a door, lid etc that allows it to swing open and shut

faith.英释: a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

blade.英释: the flat cutting part of a tool or weapon

happy.英释: having feelings of pleasure, for example because something good has happened to you or you are very satisfied with your life

caste.英释: A caste is one of the traditional social classes into which people are divided in a Hindu society

stake.英释: a pointed piece of wood, metal etc, especially one that is pushed into the ground to support something or mark a particular place

petal.英释: one of the coloured parts of a flower that are shaped like leaves

hypha.英释: any of the filaments that constitute the body (mycelium) of a fungus

crawl.英释: to move along on your hands and knees with your body close to the ground

bison.英释: an animal like a large cow, with hair on its head and shoulders

saint.英释: someone who is given the title ‘saint’ by the Christian church after they have died, because they have been very good or holy

vivid.英释: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

sweat.英释: drops of salty liquid that come out through your skin when you are hot, frightened, ill, or doing exercise

calve.英释: to give birth to a  calf

Inuit.中释: 因纽特人,  因纽特语
Inuit.英释: The Inuit are the people descended from the original people of Alaska, Eastern Canada, and Greenland

aural.英释: relating to the sense of hearing, or someone’s ability to understand sounds

onset.英释: the beginning of something, especially something bad

flank.英释: the side of an army in a battle, or a sports team when playing

rodeo.中释: 马术竞技表演会, 将牛、马驱集在一起
rodeo.英释: a type of entertainment in which  cowboy s  ride wild horses, catch cattle with ropes, and ride in races

angry.英释: feeling strong emotions which make you want to shout at someone or hurt them because they have behaved in an unfair, cruel, offensive etc way, or because you think that a situation is unfair, unacceptable etc

usher.英释: to help someone to get from one place to another, especially by showing them the way

squat.英释: to sit with your knees bent under you and your bottom just off the ground, balancing on your feet

verse.英释: words arranged in the form of poetry

spoon.英释: an object that you use for eating, cooking, or serving food. It has a small bowl-shaped part and a long handle.

chaos.英释: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

spawn.英释: the eggs of a fish or  frog  laid together in a soft mass

boost.英释: to increase or improve something and make it more successful

tally.英释: A tally is a record of amounts or numbers which you keep changing and adding to as the activity which affects it progresses

Indus.中释: 印度河（印度西北部的河流）

slave.英释: someone who is owned by another person and works for them for no money

steal.英释: to take something that belongs to someone else

brine.英释: water that contains a lot of salt and is used for preserving food

naive.英释: not having much experience of how complicated life is, so that you trust people too much and believe that good things will always happen

lapis.中释: [化]天青石(常用于化学中的矿物命名)

chunk.中释: 大块,相当大的部分（数量）
chunk.英释: a large thick piece of something that does not have an even shape

staff.英释: the people who work for an organization

asset.英释: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

pitch.英释: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

grade.英释: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is

blink.英释: to shut and open your eyes quickly

repel.英释: to make someone who is attacking you go away, by fighting them

rumen.中释: 瘤胃(反刍动物的第一胃)
rumen.英释: the first compartment of the stomach of ruminants, behind the reticulum, in which food is partly digested before being regurgitated as cud

brant.英释: a small goose, Branta bernicla, that has a dark grey plumage and short neck and occurs in most northern coastal regions

thorn.英释: a sharp point that grows on the stem of a plant such as a rose

trunk.英释: the thick central woody stem of a tree

tenth.英释: one of ten equal parts of something

guard.英释: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them

bloom.英释: if a plant or a flower blooms, its flowers appear or open

scrap.英释: to decide not to use a plan or system because it is not practical

chalk.英释: small sticks of a white or coloured substance like soft rock, used for writing or drawing

query.英释: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct

evoke.英释: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

amass.英释: if you amass money, knowledge, information etc, you gradually collect a large amount of it

glide.英释: to move smoothly and quietly, as if without effort

grasp.英释: to completely understand a fact or an idea, especially a complicated one

sixth.英释: one of six equal parts of something

sedge.英释: a plant similar to grass that grows in wet ground and on the edge of rivers and lakes

ember.英释: a piece of wood or coal that stays red and very hot after a fire has stopped burning

spill.英释: if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container

befit.英释: to be proper or suitable for someone or something

lodge.英释: If an object lodges somewhere, it becomes stuck there

endow.英释: You say that someone is endowed with a particular desirable ability, characteristic, or possession when they have it by chance or by birth

tough.英释: physically or emotionally strong and able to deal with difficult situations

skirt.英释: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress

crash.英释: to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else

spell.英释: to form a word by writing or naming the letters in order

crush.英释: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

goose.英释: the cooked meat of this bird

birch.英释: a tree with smooth  bark (=  outer covering  )  and thin branches, or the wood from this tree

Gypsy.中释: 吉普赛人(的),吉普赛语（的）
Gypsy.英释: A gypsy is a member of a race of people who travel from place to place, usually in caravans, rather than living in one place. Some people find this word offensive.

march.英释: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps

smelt.英释: to melt a rock that contains metal in order to remove the metal

rally.英释: A rally is a large public meeting that is held in order to show support for something such as a political party

gully.英释: a small narrow valley, usually formed by a lot of rain flowing down the side of a hill

panic.英释: a sudden strong feeling of fear or nervousness that makes you unable to think clearly or behave sensibly

miner.英释: someone who works under the ground in a mine to remove coal, gold etc

canoe.英释: a long light boat that is pointed at both ends and which you move along using a  paddle

apple.英释: a hard round fruit that has red, light green, or yellow skin and is white inside

quote.英释: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

blame.英释: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

ensue.英释: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

risky.英释: involving a risk that something bad will happen

skate.英释: one of a pair of boots with metal blades on the bottom, for moving quickly on ice

bowel.英释: the system of tubes inside your body where food is made into solid waste material and through which it passes out of your body

maybe.英释: used to say that something may happen or may be true but you are not certain

worry.英释: to make someone feel anxious about something

gourd.英释: a round fruit whose outer shell can be used as a container, or the container made from this fruit

valve.英释: a part of a tube or pipe that opens and shuts like a door to control the flow of liquid, gas, air etc passing through it

draft.英释: to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

amuse.英释: If something amuses you, it makes you want to laugh or smile

legal.英释: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law

shake.英释: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this

idiom.英释: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.

sting.英释: if an insect or a plant stings you, it makes a very small hole in your skin and you feel a sharp pain because of a poisonous substance

plank.英释: a long narrow piece of wooden board, used especially for making structures to walk on

brand.中释: 商标, 牌子, 烙印
brand.英释: a type of product made by a particular company, that has a particular name or design

naked.英释: not wearing any clothes or not covered by clothes

badly.英释: in an unsatisfactory or unsuccessful way

cable.英释: a plastic or rubber tube containing wires that carry telephone messages, electronic signals, television pictures etc

arrow.英释: a weapon usually made from a thin straight piece of wood with a sharp point at one end, that you shoot with a  bow

tight.英释: tight clothes fit your body very closely, especially in a way that is uncomfortable

chest.英释: Your chest is the top part of the front of your body where your ribs, lungs, and heart are

chair.中释: 椅子,主席 vt担任主席
chair.英释: a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, which has a back, a seat, and four legs

merit.英释: to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

muddy.英释: covered with mud or containing mud

label.英释: to attach a label onto something or write information on something

ether.英释: Ether is a colourless liquid that burns easily. It is used in industry and in medicine as an anaesthetic.

tenon.英释: to form a tenon on (a piece of wood)

amino.英释: of, consisting of, or containing the group of atoms -NH2

eject.英释: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

rider.中释: 骑手, 附文, 扶手
rider.英释: A rider is someone who rides a horse, a bicycle, or a motorcycle as a hobby or job. You can also refer to someone who is riding a horse, a bicycle, or a motorcycle as a rider.

opera.英释: a musical play in which all of the words are sung

lathe.英释: to shape, bore, or cut a screw thread in or on (a workpiece) on a lathe

unify.英释: if you unify two or more parts or things, or if they unify, they are combined to make a single unit

anvil.英释: a heavy iron block on which pieces of hot metal are shaped using a hammer

actor.英释: someone who performs in a play or film

trait.英释: a particular quality in someone’s character

heave.英释: a strong rising or falling movement

scope.英释: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

burin.英释: a chisel of tempered steel with a sharp lozenge-shaped point, used for engraving furrows in metal, wood, or marble

quest.英释: If you are questing for something, you are searching for it

essay.英释: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study

nurse.英释: to take special care of something, especially during a difficult situation

pluto.英释: the god of the underworld; Hades

comic.英释: amusing you and making you want to laugh

meaty.英释: containing a lot of meat, or tasting strongly of meat

clerk.英释: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

snout.英释: the long nose of some kinds of animals, such as pigs

grace.英释: to make a place or an object look more attractive

alpha.中释: 希腊字母的第一个字母
alpha.英释: the first letter in the Greek alphabet (Α, α), a vowel transliterated as a

salad.英释: a mixture of raw vegetables, especially  lettuce  ,  cucumber  , and tomato

blaze.英释: to shine with a very bright light

ghost.英释: the spirit of a dead person that some people think they can feel or see in a place

faint.英释: Someone who is faint feels weak and unsteady as if they are about to lose consciousness

youth.英释: the period of time when someone is young, especially the period when someone is a teenager

grama.中释: 美国西部产的一种牧草
grama.英释: any of various grasses of the genus Bouteloua, of W North America and South America: often used as pasture grasses

gesso.中释: (雕刻、绘画用的)石膏, 石膏粉
gesso.英释: a white ground of plaster and size, used esp in the Middle Ages and Renaissance to prepare panels or canvas for painting or gilding

stuff.英释: to push or put something into a small space, especially in a quick careless way

sepal.英释: one of the small leaves directly under a flower

brave.英释: dealing with danger, pain, or difficult situations with courage and confidence

disco.英释: a place or social event at which people dance to recorded popular music

virgo.英释: Virgo is one of the twelve signs of the zodiac. Its symbol is a young woman. People who are born approximately between the 23rd of August and the 22nd of September come under this sign.

exalt.英释: to put someone or something into a high rank or position

sword.英释: a weapon with a long pointed blade and a handle

weary.英释: to become very tired, or make someone very tired

screw.英释: to fasten or close something by turning it, or to be fastened in this way

chord.英释: a combination of several musical notes that are played at the same time and sound pleasant together

haunt.英释: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often

sleek.英释: Sleek hair or fur is smooth and shiny and looks healthy

uncle.英释: used by children, in front of a first name, to address or refer to a man who is a close friend of their parents

greet.英释: to say hello to someone or welcome them

jewel.英释: a valuable stone, such as a diamond

bluff.英释: to pretend something, especially in order to achieve what you want in a difficult or dangerous situation

tonal.英释: relating to tones of colour or sound

pedal.英释: to turn or push the pedals on a bicycle or other machine with your feet

chafe.英释: to rub part of your body to make it warm

harem.英释: part of a Muslim house that is separate from the rest of the house, where only women live

atlas.英释: a book containing maps, especially of the whole world

punch.英释: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object

lunch.英释: a meal eaten in the middle of the day

loess.英释: a light-coloured fine-grained accumulation of clay and silt particles that have been deposited by the wind

vogue.英释: a popular and fashionable style, activity, method etc

align.英释: If you align yourself with a particular group, you support them because you have the same political aim

dodge.英释: to move quickly to avoid someone or something

scant.中释: 缺乏的,不足的 v节省,减少

juice.英释: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this

cater.英释: to provide and serve food and drinks at a party, meeting etc, usually as a business

groom.英释: to clean and brush an animal, especially a horse

fleet.英释: a group of ships, or all the ships in a navy

misty.英释: misty weather is weather with a lot of mist

hurry.英释: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time

incur.英释: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

tenet.英释: a principle or belief, especially one that is part of a larger system of beliefs

ruler.英释: someone such as a king or queen who has official power over a country or area

preen.英释: if a bird preens or preens itself, it cleans itself and makes its feathers smooth using its beak

forge.英释: to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real

hover.英释: if a bird, insect, or  helicopter  hovers, it stays in one place in the air

lipid.英释: one of several types of fattysubstances in living things, such as fat, oil, or wax

viral.英释: A viral disease or infection is caused by a virus

fancy.英释: to like or want something, or want to do something

loyal.英释: always supporting your friends, principles, country etc

civic.英释: relating to a town or city

cider.英释: an alcoholic drink made from apples, or a glass of this drink

onion.英释: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or white skin and many layers. Onions have a strong taste and smell.

shear.英释: to cut the wool off a sheep

flesh.英释: the soft part of the body of a person or animal that is between the skin and the bones

excel.英释: to do something very well, or much better than most people

buyer.英释: someone who buys something expensive such as a house or car

flout.英释: If you flout something such as a law, an order, or an accepted way of behaving, you deliberately do not obey it or follow it

noble.英释: morally good or generous in a way that is admired

syrup.英释: a thick sticky sweet liquid, eaten on top of or mixed with other foods

leaky.英释: a container, roof etc that is leaky has a hole or crack in it so that liquid or gas passes through it

patty.英释: small, flat pieces of cooked meat or other food

civet.英释: any catlike viverrine mammal of the genus Viverra and related genera, of Africa and S Asia, typically having blotched or spotted fur and secreting a powerfully smelling fluid from anal glands

drown.英释: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

setup.英释: The setup of computer hardware or software is the process of installing it and making it ready to use

forum.英释: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

purge.英释: to force people to leave a place or organization because the people in power do not like them

cheer.英释: a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragement

nylon.英释: a strong artificial material that is used to make plastics, clothes, rope etc

rayon.英释: a smooth artificial cloth used for making clothes

olive.英释: a small bitter egg-shaped black or green fruit, used as food and for making oil

salal.中释: [植](产于北美洲太平洋沿岸的)沙龙白珠树

yeast.英释: a type of fungus used for producing alcohol in beer and wine, and for making bread rise

belie.英释: to give someone a false idea about something

index.英释: an alphabetical list of names, subjects etc at the back of a book, with the numbers of the pages where they can be found

attic.英释: a space or room just below the roof of a house, often used for storing things

bylaw.英释: a law made by a local government that people in that area must obey

pique.英释: a feeling of being annoyed or upset, especially because someone has ignored you or insulted you

swell.英释: to increase in amount or number

bulge.英释: a curved mass on the surface of something, usually caused by something under or inside it

cruel.英释: making someone suffer or feel unhappy

repay.英释: to pay back money that you have borrowed

curio.英释: a small object that is interesting because it is beautiful or rare

speck.英释: a very small mark, spot, or piece of something

stair.英释: a set of steps built for going from one level of a building to another

glean.英释: to collect grain that has been left behind after the crops have been cut

nevus.英释: any congenital growth or pigmented blemish on the skin; birthmark or mole

varve.英释: a typically thin band of sediment deposited annually in glacial lakes, consisting of a light layer and a dark layer deposited at different seasons

churn.英释: If something churns water, mud, or dust, it moves it about violently

brood.英释: to keep thinking about something that you are worried or upset about

mimic.英释: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh

rivet.英释: a metal pin used to fasten pieces of metal together

hairy.英释: a hairy person or animal has a lot of hair on their body

creek.英释: a small narrow stream or river

sonic.英释: relating to sound,  sound waves  , or the speed of sound

seize.英释: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

folly.英释: a very stupid thing to do, especially one that is likely to have serious results

waxes.英释: Wax is a solid, slightly shiny substance made of fat or oil that is used to make candles and polish. It melts when it is heated.

aloof.英释: unfriendly and deliberately not talking to other people

depot.英释: A depot is a place where large amounts of raw materials, equipment, arms, or other supplies are kept until they are needed

erupt.英释: if a volcano erupts, it explodes and sends smoke, fire, and rock into the sky

truck.英释: a large road vehicle used to carry goods

craze.英释: a fashion, game, type of music etc that becomes very popular for a short time

laugh.英释: to make sounds with your voice, usually while you are smiling, because you think something is funny

groan.英释: to make a long deep sound because you are in pain, upset, or disappointed, or because something is very enjoyable

cubic.英释: relating to a measurement of space which is calculated by multiplying the length of something by its width and height

taint.英释: to damage something by adding an unwanted substance to it

stilt.英释: one of two poles which you can stand on and walk high above the ground

stele.英释: an upright stone slab or column decorated with figures or inscriptions, common in prehistoric times

overt.英释: overt actions are done publicly, without trying to hide anything

abuse.英释: cruel or violent treatment of someone

slimy.英释: covered with  slime  , or wet and slippery like slime

ditch.英释: a long narrow hole dug at the side of a field, road etc to hold or remove unwanted water

hobby.英释: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time

facet.中释: 小平面, 方面, 刻面

filmy.英释: A filmy fabric or substance is very thin and almost transparent

chant.英释: a regularly repeated tune, often with many words sung on one note, especially used for religious prayers

swear.英释: to say very strongly that what you are saying is true

lover.英释: someone’s lover is the person they are having a sexual relationship with but who they are not married to

creed.英释: a set of beliefs or principles

badge.英释: a small piece of metal, cloth, or plastic with a picture or words on it, worn to show rank, membership of a group, support for a political idea etc

vowel.英释: one of the human speech sounds that you make by letting your breath flow out without closing any part of your mouth or throat

towel.英释: a piece of cloth that you use for drying your skin or for drying things such as dishes

cache.英释: to hide something in a secret place, especially weapons

guest.英释: someone who is invited to an event or special occasion

crest.英释: a group of feathers that stick up on the top of a bird’s head

strap.英释: to fasten something or someone in place with one or more straps

sully.英释: to spoil or reduce the value of something that was perfect

modal.英释: modal meanings are concerned with the attitude of the speaker to the hearer or to what is being said

brawl.英释: to quarrel or fight in a noisy way, especially in a public place

midst.英释: in the middle of a place or a group of things or people

penal.英释: relating to the legal punishment of criminals, especially in prisons

daddy.英释: father – used especially by children or when speaking to children

honey.英释: a sweet sticky substance produced by  bees  , used as food

venom.中释: (蛇的)毒液, 恶意 vt放毒, 使恶毒

spiny.英释: a spiny animal or plant has lots of stiff sharp points

curly.中释: 卷曲的, 弯曲的, (木材)有皱状纹理的

needy.中释: 贫困的, 缺乏生活必需品的
needy.英释: having very little food or money

tread.中释: 踏, 步态 v踏,  跳

mania.中释: [医]颠狂, 狂躁, 癖好, 狂热
mania.英释: a strong desire for something or interest in something, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time

stash.英释: to store something secretly or safely somewhere

affix.中释: 使附于, 粘贴 n[语]词缀

trove.中释: 被发现的东西, 收藏的东西

vault.英释: a roof or ceiling that consists of several arches that are joined together, especially in a church

forte.英释: to be something that you do well or are skilled at

suite.英释: a set of rooms, especially expensive ones in a hotel

twine.英释: strong string made by twisting together two or more threads or strings

video.中释: 录象, 视频 a视频的
video.英释: a digital recording of an event, for example one made using a mobile phone

haven.英释: a place where people or animals can live peacefully or go to in order to be safe

wring.中释: 绞, 扭, 折磨 n绞, 扭动
wring.英释: to tightly twist a wet cloth or wet clothes in order to remove water

comer.英释: anyone who wants to take part in an activity, especially a sporting competition

scowl.中释: 愁容, 皱眉 v皱眉

crimp.中释: 起皱, 卷曲, 抑制

deter.英释: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

gloss.英释: a bright shine on a surface

guess.英释: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct

frill.英释: a decoration that consists of narrow piece of cloth that has many small folds in it

cigar.英释: a thick tube-shaped thing that people smoke, and which is made from tobacco leaves that have been rolled up

haste.英释: great speed in doing something, especially because you do not have enough time

aloud.英释: if you read, laugh, say something etc aloud, you read etc so that people can hear you

beard.英释: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks

grape.英释: one of a number of small round green or purple fruits that grow together on a  vine . Grapes are often used for making wine

perch.英释: a branch or stick where a bird sits

awake.中释: 醒,唤醒 a警觉的, 醒的
awake.英释: to wake up, or to make someone wake up

grope.英释: to try to find something that you cannot see by feeling with your hands

decor.英释: the way that the inside of a building is decorated

wrist.英释: the part of your body where your hand joins your arm

bugle.英释: to play or sound (on) a bugle

ankle.英释: the joint between your foot and your leg

royal.英释: relating to or belonging to a king or queen

hydra.中释: [希神]九头怪蛇, 难以根除之祸害, [动]水螅
hydra.英释: a snake in ancient Greek stories with many heads that grow again when they are cut off

utter.英释: to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty

annex.英释: to take control of a country or area next to your own, especially by using force

knead.英释: to press a mixture of flour and water many times with your hands

boron.英释: a very hard almost colourless crystalline metalloid element that in impure form exists as a brown amorphous powder. It occurs principally in borax and is used in hardening steel. The naturally occurring isotope boron-10 is used in nuclear control rods and neutron detection instruments. Symbol: B; atomic no: 5; atomic wt: 10.81; valency: 3; relative density: 2.34 (crystalline), 2.37 (amorphous); melting pt: 2092°C; boiling pt: 4002°C

arena.英释: a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place

waist.中释: 腰部, 衣服的上身部分
waist.英释: the narrow part in the middle of the human body

thigh.英释: the top part of your leg, between your knee and your  hip

bleak.中释: 寒冷的,荒凉的, 黯淡的
bleak.英释: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

serum.英释: a liquid containing substances that fight infection or poison, that is put into a sick person’s blood

silly.英释: not sensible, or showing bad judgment

Cuban.英释: Cuban means belonging or relating to Cuba, or to its people or culture

dough.英释: a mixture of flour and water ready to be baked into bread,  pastry  etc

flair.英释: a natural ability to do something very well

bless.英释: used to show that you are fond of someone, amused by them, or pleased by something they have done

pivot.英释: to turn or balance on a central point, or to make something do this
